summary:
The Security Council:

* Welcomes Sudan's request to increase African Union monitoring presence in Darfur and urges Sudan to cooperate with the African Union to ensure a secure environment (para 3).
* Calls on Sudan and rebel groups to work towards a political solution under African Union auspices, and urges parties to sign and implement a humanitarian agreement and conclude a security protocol (para 4).
* Urges Sudan and the Sudan People's Liberation Movement to conclude a comprehensive peace accord (para 5).
* Affirms the right of internally displaced persons and refugees to return home voluntarily, safely, and with dignity (para 6).
* Reiterates its call for Sudan to end impunity in Darfur, bring perpetrators to justice, and stop all violence and atrocities (para 7).
* Calls on Sudanese parties to address ceasefire violations and hold accountable those responsible (para 8).
* Demands Sudan submit documentation on disarmament of Janjaweed militiamen and those arrested for human rights abuses (para 9).
* Demands all armed groups cease violence, cooperate with humanitarian efforts, and ensure humanitarian staff safety (para 10).
* Reiterates support for the N'djamena ceasefire agreement and urges Sudan to refrain from military flights over Darfur (para 11).
* Requests the Secretary-General to establish an international commission of inquiry into human rights abuses in Darfur (para 12).
* Calls on Member States to provide urgent humanitarian assistance to Darfur and Chad (para 13).
* Warns that failure by Sudan to comply with resolutions may lead to additional measures, including actions on Sudan's petroleum sector (para 14).
* Requests the Secretary-General to report on Sudan's compliance with Council demands (para 15).
* Decides to remain seized of the matter (para 16).
